newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Wednesday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Wednesday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Wednesday:

Spokesman Nikolaus van der Pas said there was no link between the Madrid NATO summit invitation to Hungary, the Czech Republic and Poland to start entry talks immediately and the Commission's opinion on applications to join the European Union. Van der Pas added that accession to the EU was no consolation prize for countries that have not benefited from the NATO enlargement.
Van der Pas said spokesman Jochen Kubosch would brief in his office at 1515/1315 GMT on the electronic payments recommendation adopted by the Commission.
Van der Pas announced that spokesman Peter Guilford was getting engaged.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/97/622: Commission sends reasoned opinion to Greece on real estate purchase restrictions.
- IP/97/623: ECU 13.4 million for the protection of forests in the EU.
- IP/97/624: Commission asks Portugal to end aid for "Empresa para a Agroalimentacao e Cereais S.A. (EPAC).
- IP/97/625: Commission proposes directive on environment-friendly handling of end of life vehicles.
- IP/97/627: Commission proposes directive on legal protection of conditional access services.
- IP/97/629: 1997 Report of the demographic situation in the EU.
- Eurostat news release No 49/97: EU unemployment: 10.8% again in May.
- Global information networks ministerial conference - Ministerial declaration.
- Selling prices of petroleum products in Ecus.
